department.ch: 化學工程與材料工程學系

remark.ch: 研究所領域分類:材料類

goal.en: Material properties are often determined by its hierarchical structure from molecular to macroscopic levels, and the processing methods can greatly affect those structures. To ensure the reproducibility of the product material, selecting the right characterization tools is important from the process design point of view.
goal.ch: Material properties are often determined by its hierarchical structure from molecular to macroscopic levels, and the processing methods can greatly affect those structures. To ensure the reproducibility of the product material, selecting the right characterization tools is important from the process design point of view.

content.en:
Professor Akon Higuchi will cover:
(1) FT-IR principle and analysis of polymers,
(2) Surface analysis of biomaterials (XPS, contact angle, atomic force microscopy)
(3) Rheology and contact angle measurements of polymeric materials,
(4) NMR principle and analysis of polymers
(5) Bioanalysis (Phase inverted microscopy, Confocal laser microscopy, RT-PCR, qRT-PCR, DNA array)
Professor Tu Lee will cover:
Two common, but often overlooked thermal analytical techniques: differential scanning calorimetry (DSC), and thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) for solids will be related to structural purity and processing routes. Different case studies of NMR, FTIR, HPLC, XPS, DSC, TGA, PXRD, SXD, SAXS, AFM, SEM, polarized OM, BET, PL, PVM, FBRM and particle sieving will be discussed in depth through group presentations.
content.ch:
Professor Akon Higuchi will cover:
(1) FT-IR principle and analysis of polymers,
(2) Surface analysis of biomaterials (XPS, contact angle, atomic force microscopy)
(3) Rheology and contact angle measurements of polymeric materials,
(4) NMR principle and analysis of polymers
(5) Bioanalysis (Phase inverted microscopy, Confocal laser microscopy, RT-PCR, qRT-PCR, DNA array)
Professor Tu Lee will cover:
Two common, but often overlooked thermal analytical techniques: differential scanning calorimetry (DSC), and thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) for solids will be related to structural purity and processing routes. Different case studies of NMR, FTIR, HPLC, XPS, DSC, TGA, PXRD, SXD, SAXS, AFM, SEM, polarized OM, BET, PL, PVM, FBRM and particle sieving will be discussed in depth through group presentations.

textbook.en: Giron, D. Thermal analysis and calorimetric methods in the characterization of polymorphs and solvates. Thermochimica Acta. 1995, 248, 1-59.
textbook.ch: Giron, D. Thermal analysis and calorimetric methods in the characterization of polymorphs and solvates. Thermochimica Acta. 1995, 248, 1-59.

grading.en: The 18-week course, CH7009 Materials Characterization, will be taught in English by Professor Akon Higuchi for the first 6 weeks from 2/19 to 3/25, and Professor Tu Lee for the remaining 12 weeks from 4/1 to 6/17. The final total grade 100％ is the sum of Professor Akon Higuchi’s section of 33％, and Professor Tu Lee’s section of 67％. The grade percentage for Professor Akon Higuchi’s section will be: (1) short tests in the classes of 13％ (2) final exam of 20％. Therefore, the perfect score in this part of the course is 33％. The grade percentage for Professor Tu Lee’s section will be: (1) attendance of 10％ (2) group presentation of 34％ (3) final exam of 23％. Therefore, the perfect score in this part of the course is 67％.

The grade percentage for Professor Tu Lee’s section will be: (1) attendance of 10％ (2) group presentation of 34％ (3) final exam of 23％. Therefore, the perfect score in this part of the course is 67％.

domain.en: 化材工程專業課程 、 物質檢測及鑑定分析
